thread.title: Take off on new flight options for Canadians
thread.title_full: Take off on new flight options for Canadians

title: Take off on new flight options for Canadians
text:
October 8, 2015 Photos ( 6 ) Iceland-based WOW Air will start flying from Toronto and Montreal to Reykjavik, Iceland in May 2016, with fares starting at $99 CAD one-way including tax. 
The news keeps getting better for Canadian travellers who want to explore the planet. 
WestJet has been steadily increasing its offerings. The Calgary-based airline recently announced they will be flying to London’s Gatwick Airport from five Canadian cities (Vancouver, Calgary, Edmonton, Winnipeg, Toronto and St. John’s) starting May 2016. The airline already flies to Dublin from St. John’s. 
Air Canada rouge , which bills itself as a leisure carrier and does not have the same comfort level or service offerings as Air Canada , will start flying from Toronto to London Gatwick on May 19, with flights up to seven times a week. A new Air Canada non-stop from Montreal to Lyon, France starts the month after that. 
On top of all that, word came down last week that Iceland-based WOW Air will start flying from Toronto and Montreal to Reykjavik, Iceland in May 2016, with fares starting at $99 CAD one-way including tax. For another $149 one-way, also including tax, folks will be able to fly from Iceland to several cities in Europe, including Paris, London, Berlin, Rome, Barcelona and Copenhagen. 
Porter Airlines announced it will start its service between Toronto and Myrtle Beach on Feb. 11, 2016. There are flights up to five times a week and daily flights during March Break. The flights will run until May 23. Porter also announced flights to Florida for the first time. From Dec. 19 to April 30, 2016, Porter will offer weekly, non-stop flights between Billy Bishop Toronto City Airport and Orlando-Melbourne International Airport, which is about 90 minutes from Walt Disney World and just 10 minutes from the beach. Introductory prices were set at $392 CAD for a round-trip ticket. 
Meanwhile, National Airlines will start flying from Windsor, Ont. to Orlando-Sanford Airport starting Dec. 17, 2016. For Orlando fans out west, National also announced flights from Vancouver to Orlando-Melbourne, starting Jan. 20, 2016. 
Prices for all flights vary, so check online or call the airlines to find the best deal.
